intro: Digitaria sanguinalis var. aegyptiaca, commonly known as Egyptian digitaria, is a grass species native to Africa and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its slender,丛生 growth habit and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spikelet-based flowers that are typically green or reddish in color. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural fields and along roadsides. Due to its adaptability, it is considered a weed in many regions.
